title: [BUG] no matches found: [all_extras,dev]
body:
**Describe the bug**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
-->
When trying to install dev dependencies / all dependencies I get:
```
zsh: no matches found: [all_extras,dev]
```

**To Reproduce**
<!--
Add a Minimal, Complete, and Verifiable example (for more details, see e.g. https://stackoverflow.com/help/mcve

If the code is too long, feel free to put it in a public gist and link it in the issue: https://gist.github.com
-->
System Specifications:
```
Distributor ID:	Pop
Description:	Pop!_OS 21.10
Release:	21.10
Codename:	impish
```

In Bash/Zsh enter:
```bash
pip install -e .[all_extras,dev]
```

**Expected behavior**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.
-->
Command should be accepted and start installation of required packages. 

**Additional context**
<!--
Add any other context about the problem here.
-->
This mostly seems to be a Ubuntu issue since it generally does not recognise special characters in the terminal. With a bit of digging around a simple solution to it is to instead use
```
pip install -e ."[all_extras,dev]"
```
We should update the installation guide with the solution.

**Versions**
<details>

<!--
Please run the following code snippet and paste the output here:
 
from sktime import show_versions; show_versions()
-->
```
>>> show_versions()

System:
    python: 3.9.7 (default, Sep 10 2021, 14:59:43)  [GCC 11.2.0]
executable: /home/shivansh/Desktop/Intern/GSoC/sktime/sktime-dev/bin/python3
   machine: Linux-5.17.5-76051705-generic-x86_64-with-glibc2.34

Python dependencies:
          pip: 20.3.4
   setuptools: 44.1.1
      sklearn: 1.1.1
       sktime: 0.11.4
  statsmodels: 0.13.2
        numpy: 1.21.6
        scipy: 1.8.1
       pandas: 1.4.2
   matplotlib: 3.5.2
       joblib: 1.1.0
        numba: 0.55.2
     pmdarima: 1.8.5
      tsfresh: 0.19.0

```

</details>

<!-- Thanks for contributing! -->
